item.title: Meditations in an Emergency
item.description: .cls-1 { fill: #f6f6f6; } â† â†’ Dedicated to breaking all vicious cycles Catherine Bresner is the author of the empty season, which won the Diode Edition Book Prize in 2017. She currently works as the publicist for Wave Books and lives in Brattleboro, VT. In order of appearance...

item.title: Love Is the Death of Duty
item.description: .cls-1 { fill: #f6f6f6; } â† â†’ O! never say that I was false of heart, Though absence seemed my flame to qualify. As easy might I from myself depart As from my soul, which in thy breast doth lie: That is my home of love; if I have ranged, Like him that travels, I return again,

item.title: Heaven Missing
item.description: .cls-1 { fill: #f6f6f6; } â† â†’ Should auld acquaintance be forgot And never brought to mind? Should auld acquaintance be forgot And days of auld lang syne? For auld lang syne, my dear For auld lang syne We'll tak a cup o' kindness yet

item.title: Dontcha Think It's Time
item.description: .cls-1 { fill: #f6f6f6; } â† â†’ June & July 2020 The police exist to keep us safe, or so we are told by mainstream media and popular culture. TV shows exaggerate the amount of serious crime and the nature of what most police officers actually do all day. Crime control is a small part of policing, and it always has been.
